conclusion: Triangle ABC is a right triangular prism with angle A = 90 degrees and angle B = 60 degrees.
A thin light beam starts from point D on side BC, reflects off point E on side AC, undergoes total internal reflection at point F on side AB, and exits.
EG is perpendicular to AC intersecting BC at G.
Point D is exactly the midpoint of CG.
The angle of deviation of the incident light relative to point D is 36 degrees.
